title.value: Solitary-like waves in a liquid foam microchannel

affiliations.name: Université Côte d'Azur, CNRS, LPMC, France
Université Côte d'Azur, CNRS, INLN, France
Institut Universitaire de France, 75005 Paris, France

abstract.value: Plateau borders (PBs) are liquid microchannels located at the contact between three bubbles in liquid foams. They are stable, deformable, and can be thought of as quasi-one-dimensional model systems to study surface waves in fluid dynamics. We show that the burst of a bubble trapped in a PB produces local constrictions which travel along the liquid channel at constant velocity, without significant change in shape. These patterns are reminiscent of the depression solitary waves encountered in nonlinear systems. By coupling flow inertia to capillary stresses, we derive a simple model that admits solitonic solutions, which we characterized numerically and analytically in the limit of small deformation. These solutions capture most of the features observed experimentally.
